section.title: Measurement Based Quantum Computation (MBQC) Simulator (MBQC V0.01)
section.para: Measurement-based quantum computation (MBQC) is an alternative computational model to the circuit-based quantum computation (CBQC) model. While many quantum computing simulators like

are based on the CBQC model. QuEST stands out by offering flexibility with mid-circuit measurement and the ability to perform feed-forward actions, such as adaptive basis measurements for future qubits.
This repository aims to simulate a general MBQC framework using QuEST and leveraging the Boost Graph Library (BGL), which is developed under the Boost library in C++.
By combining QuEST's capabilities with the power of the Boost Graph Library, this project provides a versatile MBQC simulator.

listitem.para: Currently, MBQC++ offers variable sized one and two dimensional lattices.

section.title: Project status
section.para: This project is in active development, labelled as version 0.01. There is some basic functionality in this repositors, but by no means is a complete simulator. To run this repository see below for external library requirements.

section.title: External library requirements
section.para: Along with the standard C/C++ libraries there are two additional external libraries. Since MBQC is a graph theoretic based paradigm, the numerical library, Boost is called and with it, its graph library. To performthe quantum computation the current backend simulator is QuEST. Each of these libraries can be found here:

listitem.para:
Boost: https://www.boost.org/
Boost graph library: https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_78_0/libs/graph/doc/index.html
Download: https://www.boost.org/users/download/
Homebrew: https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/boost

QuEST: https://quest.qtechtheory.org/
Download page: https://quest.qtechtheory.org/download/
Github: https://github.com/QuEST-Kit/QuEST
Github organisation: https://github.com/QuEST-Kit
Documentation: https://quest-kit.github.io/QuEST/modules.html

section.para: These (Boost and QuEST) are both REQUIRED to run this MBQC. GraphViz is required to print graphs to file.

listitem.para: Clone this repos with git clone git@github.com:ediparquantum/MBQC.git (I use ssh, use what works for you) to $HOME/Projects
Make a directory called build in $HOME/Projects/MBQC with mkdir build.
Navigate to build (eg cd build assuming you are already in cd $HOME/Projects/MBQC)
